commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 0. Greet: - Add introductory message - Add exit message
Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class
Revert "Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class"
Update UI design + Add display UI method to "Duke" class

commitResults.messageBody:
DukeInterface.java:
- Add scanner object to read user input
- Add method "readInput" to read user input in command line
- Add method "echoInput" to echo user input from "readinput" method

Duke.java
- Updated Duke.java to use do-while loop to allow for multiple user inputs in single program execution (invokes "readInput" method from DukeInterface.java)
- Terminates Duke.java when user inputs "bye"

User can now add tasks to Duke + print all tasks added

Add Task.java class
- To describe each Task as an object
- Add method "getTaskDescription" to return Task description

Add TaskManager.java class
- To manage multiple Task objects
- Add method "addTask" to add on new Task object to Duke's Tasklist
- Add method "printTasks" to print all added Task objects to Duke's Tasklist

Update Duke.java
- Add TaskManager object
- Change do-while loop to while loop + modified loop condition

General Update
- Polish user interface + Duke's personality

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 3. Mark as Done + Tweak code to comply with coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.java
- Revert back to do-while loop for program execution
- Use if-else instead of switch statement to process user command
- Add additional if-else condition to check command contains "done " + invoke method "setTaskComplete" via TaskManager object

DukeInterface.java
- Modify various UI messages
- Add more functions to print various UI formats (includes emojis)

Task.java
- Add "getStatusIcon" method to mark task as done

TaskManager
- Use DukeInterface customised print methods instead of System.out.println method to display text/messages
- Tidy up code
